title: Comprehensive Final Exam: The Three Fundamental Principles

questions.question: What is the first matter that is obligatory upon us to learn?
questions.questionArabic: مَا هِيَ الْمَسْأَلَةُ الْأُولَى الَّتِي يَجِبُ عَلَيْنَا تَعَلُّمُهَا؟
options: Knowledge (of Allah, His Prophet, and His Religion)
questions.explanation: Knowledge precedes speech and action. Imam Bukhari titled a chapter: 'Knowledge comes before speech and action'.
questions.explanationArabic: الْعِلْمُ قَبْلَ الْقَوْلِ وَالْعَمَلِ، كَمَا بَوَّبَ الْبُخَارِيُّ رَحِمَهُ اللهُ.

questions.question: According to Imam Ash-Shafi'i, which Surah would have been sufficient as proof against creation?
questions.questionArabic: مَا هِيَ السُّورَةُ الَّتِي قَالَ عَنْهَا الشَّافِعِيُّ لَوْ لَمْ يُنْزِلِ اللهُ حُجَّةً غَيْرَهَا لَكَفَتْهُمْ؟
questions.explanation: Because it contains the four levels of success: Knowledge, Action, Dawah, and Patience.
questions.explanationArabic: لِأَنَّهَا اشْتَمَلَتْ عَلَى مَرَاتِبِ النَّجَاةِ الأَرْبَعِ: الْعِلْمِ، وَالْعَمَلِ، وَالدَّعْوَةِ، وَالصَّبْرِ.

questions.question: What is the greatest thing Allah has commanded?
questions.questionArabic: مَا هُوَ أَعْظَمُ مَا أَمَرَ اللهُ بِهِ؟
questions.explanation: Tawheed is singling out Allah in worship, and it is the purpose of creation.
questions.explanationArabic: التَّوْحِيدُ هُوَ إِفْرَادُ اللهِ بِالْعِبَادَةِ، وَهُوَ الْغَايَةُ مِنَ الْخَلْقِ.

questions.question: If you are asked 'Who is your Lord?', what is the correct answer?
questions.questionArabic: إِذَا قِيلَ لَكَ: مَنْ رَبُّكَ؟ فَمَا الْجَوَابُ؟
options: My Lord is the Prophet Muhammad
My Lord is Allah who nurtured me and all the worlds
optionsArabic: رَبِّيَ اللهُ الَّذِي رَبَّانِي وَرَبَّى جَمِيعَ الْعَالَمِينَ بِنِعَمِهِ
questions.explanation: Allah is the Rabb (Lord) meaning the Creator, Owner, and Nurturer of all things.
questions.explanationArabic: اللهُ هُوَ الرَّبُّ بِمَعْنَى الْخَالِقِ الْمَالِكِ الْمُدَبِّرِ لِجَمِيعِ الْمَخْلُوقَاتِ.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT one of the 5 Pillars of Islam?
questions.questionArabic: أَيٌّ مِمَّا يَلِي لَيْسَ مِنْ أَرْكَانِ الْإِسْلَامِ الْخَمْسَةِ؟
questions.explanation: Belief in Angels is a Pillar of Iman, not Islam.
questions.explanationArabic: الْإِيمَانُ بِالْمَلَائِكَةِ مِنْ أَرْكَانِ الْإِيمَانِ، وَلَيْسَ مِنْ أَرْكَانِ الْإِسْلَامِ.

questions.question: What is the definition of Ihsan?
options: To worship Allah as if you see Him
To pray only in the Masjid
questions.explanation: This is the highest level of religion: 'To worship Allah as if you see Him, and if you do not see Him, He sees you.'
questions.explanationArabic: هُوَ أَعْلَى مَرَاتِبِ الدِّينِ: «أَنْ تَعْبُدَ اللهَ كَأَنَّكَ تَرَاهُ، فَإِنْ لَمْ تَكُنْ تَرَاهُ فَإِنَّهُ يَرَاكَ».

questions.question: The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ was sent to:
questions.explanation: His message is universal. Allah said: 'Say, O Mankind, indeed I am the Messenger of Allah to you all.'
questions.explanationArabic: رِسَالَتُهُ عَامَّةٌ. قَالَ تَعَالَى: ﴿قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِنِّي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ إِلَيْكُمْ جَمِيعًا﴾.

questions.question: What is the definition of Taghut according to Ibn Al-Qayyim?
questions.questionArabic: مَا هُوَ تَعْرِيفُ الطَّاغُوتِ عِنْدَ ابْنِ الْقَيِّمِ؟
options: Anything by which a servant exceeds his limit (worshipped, followed, obeyed)
optionsArabic: مَا تَجَاوَزَ بِهِ الْعَبْدُ حَدَّهُ مِنْ مَعْبُودٍ أَوْ مَتْبُوعٍ أَوْ مُطَاعٍ
questions.explanation: This is the comprehensive definition: exceeding the limits in worship, following, or obedience.
questions.explanationArabic: هَذَا هُوَ التَّعْرِيفُ الْجَامِعُ: مُجَاوَزَةُ الْحَدِّ فِي الْعِبَادَةِ أَوِ الْاتِّبَاعِ أَوِ الطَّاعَةِ.

questions.question: What happens to those who deny the Resurrection (Al-Ba'th)?
questions.explanation: Allah says: 'Those who disbelieve have claimed that they will never be resurrected.'
questions.explanationArabic: قَالَ تَعَالَى: ﴿زَعَمَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَنْ لَنْ يُبْعَثُوا﴾.

questions.question: With which Surah was the Prophet ﷺ made a Messenger (Rasool)?
questions.questionArabic: بِأَيِّ سُورَةٍ أُرْسِلَ النَّبِيُّ ﷺ (صَارَ رَسُولًا)؟
questions.explanation: He was made a Prophet (Nabi) with 'Iqra' and a Messenger (Rasool) with 'Al-Muddathir' (Arise and Warn).
